title: Going Down Under
content:
I’m headed to [Australia](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709013021/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Australia) on May 28 to spend a couple days in Sydney before I’m off to Cairns for two weeks of pure nature and no internet.

Any Aussies have some recommendations for design/art stuff I shouldn’t miss in Sydney? Would be nice to hook up for some drinks with the local Typophiles, too.

Thanks!

 [‹ Video game posters at USC's GamePipe](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709013021/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33711 "Go to previous forum topic") [cover letters? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709013021/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33654 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Stephen Coles

comments.content:
Hey I’m based in Sydney, and wouldn’t mind hooking up for a few drinks.

In terms of design stuff, well there’s the [Museum of Contemporary Art](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709013021/http:/www.mca.com.au/), and the [Powerhouse Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709013021/http:/www.powerhousemuseum.com/dfactory/index.asp).

I’ll have a think about a few others...

Sydney?! Booo! Melbourne’s where you need to head for culture, art and design! (...And let the inter-city Holy War BEGIN!) :) Sorry I can’t help with any recommendations, Stephen.

Enjoy your time off from the Internet! Are you leaving your phone at home as well?

When I was in Sydney a couple of years ago, the highlight was the aforementioned Powerhouse Museum, so definitely try and go. I’m afraid the other things I did were the more traditional touristy things — but if you’re interested in those kinds of things, the [Taronga Zoo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709013021/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taronga_Zoo) was incredible. I’ve never seen such amazing animals in my life, but if you’re going to be with nature for two weeks, you may want a bit more of human culture in Sydney.
